SEARCH
Module edu.uoc.uocanoid
Package edu.uoc.uocanoid.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.uocanoid.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
GameController class.

This class is the controller of the game. It is the middleware between the model and the view,.

Author:
David García Solórzano

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(String fileFolder, int width, int height, Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> initData) throws IOException
      Constructor with arguments.
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.
      width - Stage's width.
      height - Stage's height.
      initData - Initial data related to the view that is needed in the controller and model.
      Throws:
      IOException - When there is a problem while retrieving number of levels

      Getter of the attribute currentLevel.
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute currentLevel that indicates which level the player is playing.

    • setCurrentLevel

      private void setCurrentLevel(int currentLevel)
      Setter of the attribute currentLevel.
      The new value is assigned as long as it is greater than 0. Otherwise, the current value remains.
      Parameters:
      currentLevel - New value for the attribute currentLevel.

      Returns:

      private void setScore(int score)
      Setter of the attribute score.
      The new value is assigned as long as it is 0 or a positive number. Otherwise, the current value remains.
      Parameters:
      score - New value for the attribute points.

      Returns:

      public void setNumLives(int numLives)
      Setter of the attribute numLives.
      The new value is assigned as long as it is 0 or a positive number. Otherwise, the current value remains.
      Parameters:
      numLives - New value for the attribute numLives.

    • getMAX_LEVELS

      public int getMAX_LEVELS()
      Getter of the attribute maxLevels.
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute maxLevels.

    • isGameFinished

      public boolean isGameFinished()
      Indicates if the game is finished (true) or not (false).

      The game is finished when the attribute currentLevel is equal to the attribute maxLevels.

      Returns:
      True if there are no more levels and therefore the game is finished. Otherwise, false.

    • isLevelCompleted

      public boolean isLevelCompleted()
      Checks if the level is completed.
      Returns:
      true if this level is beaten, otherwise false.

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Checks if the player has lost, i.e. the number of lives is zero.
      Returns:
      true if this the player has lost, otherwise false.

    • nextLevel

      public boolean nextLevel() throws LevelException
      Checks if there is a new level to play and loads it.
      If the game is finished, it returns false. Otherwise, it updates currentLevel, loads the new level and returns true.
      Returns:
      true if there is a next level, and it has been loaded correctly. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem loading the new level.

    • loadLevel

      private void loadLevel() throws LevelException
      Loads a new level by using the values of the attributes currentLevel and INIT_DATA.

      The pattern of the filename is: fileFolder+"level" + numberLevel + ".txt".

      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • getBricks

      public List<Brick> getBricks()
      It returns the Brick objects of the current level as a List.
      Returns:
      Brick objects of the current level.

    • getBallData

      public Map<String,Integer> getBallData()
      It returns, as a Map, the values of the following ball's attributes of the current level:
      • x
      • y
      • radius
      • xDirection
      • yDirection
      • speed
      With the object that is returned, it is possible to do: obj.get("x") and retrieve the value of the ball's x.
      Returns:
      Ball's data of the current level in a Map format.

    • getPaddleData

      public Map<String,Integer> getPaddleData()
      It returns, as a Map, the values of the following paddle's attributes of the current level:
      • x
      • y
      • width
      • height
      • direction
      • speed
      With the object that is returned, it is possible to do: obj.get("x") and retrieve the value of the paddle's x.
      Returns:
      Paddle's data of the current level in a Map format.

    • swapBallXDirection

      private void swapBallXDirection()
      Change the direction of the ball in x-axis.

    • swapBallYDirection

      private void swapBallYDirection()
      Change the direction of the ball in y-axis.

    • checkCollisionBricks

      private void checkCollisionBricks()
      For each brick which is alive in the level, it checks if the ball is in its range. If the ball is in the brick's range, then the ball's y direction must be changed and the brick's current number of hits must be also updated. Moreover, if as a result of the hit the brick is broken, then the brick's points must be added to the game's score and the brick must be removed from the level.

      Regarding the ball's x direction, this must be changed if the ball hits the brick in the border. This means that: On the left, the ball's x is equal to or less than the brick's x. On the right, the ball's x is equal to or greater than the brick's most-righted x minus the ball's width.

    • checkCollisionScene

      private void checkCollisionScene()
      It checks if the ball exceeds the stage (right, left or top).

      If the ball exceeds in the x-axis (right/left), then swapBallXDirection must be invoked. If the ball exceeds in the y-axis (top), then swapBallYDirection must be invoked.

      Hint: you should notice that ball's (x,y) are the top-left corner of the ball.

    • checkCollisionPaddle

      private void checkCollisionPaddle()
      It checks if the ball is in paddle's range. If the ball is in the paddle's range, then the ball's y direction must be changed.

      Regarding the ball's x direction, this must be changed if the ball hits the paddle in the border. This means that: On the left, the ball's x is equal to less than the paddle's x. On the right, the ball's x is equal to or greater than the paddle's most-righted x minus the ball's width.

    • checkCollisionBottom

      private boolean checkCollisionBottom()
      It checks if the ball exceeds the paddle's y.
      If the ball exceeds the paddle's y, then the player must lose one life. Moreover, the game must be restored.
      Returns:
      true if the ball exceeds the paddle's y. Otherwise, it returns false.

    • movePaddle

      public void movePaddle(XDirection direction)
      It moves the Paddle object of the current in the direction indicated by parameter.

      This method moves the paddle if any part of the paddle in the future position is not out of the stage. Remember that size of the stage are 0 (left) and WIDTH. Likewise, the new position of the paddle it will be the result of adding its speed in its current direction.

      Parameters:
      direction - Direction in which the player wants the paddle to move.

    • moveBall

      private void moveBall()
      It invokes the Ball's move method.

    • update

      public boolean update()
      If the level is completed, then it does nothing and returns false. Otherwise, it invokes the following methods in this order: checkCollisionPaddle, moveBall, checkCollisionBricks, checkCollisionScene and checkCollisionBottom. In this case, this method returns the value returned by checkCollisionBottom.
      Returns:
      The value returned by checkCollisionBottom.

    • restore

      public void restore()
      It invokes the Ball's restore method.
